natural solution: First, multiply both sides by the denominator to obtain $\sqrt[3]{2x-4} = 2\sqrt[3]{x+4}$. Cubing both sides, $$2x-4 = 8 \cdot (x+4) = 8x + 32.$$Thus, $6x = -36 \Longrightarrow x = \boxed{-6}$.
